ContentIndexEvent.summary: NOTE Experimental The ContentIndexEvent interface of the content index defines the object used to represent the event.

remarks.para: This event is sent to the global scope of a . It contains the id of the indexed content to be removed.
The event is only fired when the deletion happens due to interaction with the browser's built-in user interface. It is not fired when the method is called.

-An introductory article on the Content Index API
-Service Worker API, along with information about Cache and CacheStorage

ContentIndexEventContentIndexEvent.summary:
NOTE Experimental The ContentIndexEvent() constructor creates a new object
whose type and other options are configured as specified.

remarks.para:
-An introductory article on the Content Index API
-Service Worker API, along with information about Cache and CacheStorage

ContentIndexEventContentIndexEvent.returns: A new object configured using the given options.

ContentIndexEventId.summary:
NOTE Experimental The id read-only property of the
interface is a {{jsxref('String')}} which identifies
the deleted content index via its id.

remarks.para:
-An introductory article on the Content Index API
-Service Worker API, along with information about Cache and CacheStorage

ContentIndexEventId.value: A representation of the deleted content index id.
